infos.title: Capella
infos.author: Thales
infos.description:
Capella is a field-proven model driven engineering solution based on a graphical modeling workbench for engineers developing systems, software and hardware architectures.

It provides a domain-specific language (DSL) implementing Arcadia, both as a simplification and a semantic enrichment of the UML and SysML standards.

lnks.nom: Strategy for building custom modeling workbenches

infos.title: Mindstorms Designer
infos.author: Obeo
infos.description:
A tool for describing the choreography of a Lego Mindstorms robot: go forward, rotate, grab, release.
Java code is generated automatically and can be uploaded on the robot to execute the described choreography.

infos.title: Advocate
infos.author: Nasa
infos.description: AdvoCATE is a toolset developed by NASA's Ames Research Center to specify Safety/assurance cases. AdvoCATE facilitates model-based development, exploiting validations, transformations, and a range of views in the construction of (some of) the artifacts constituting a safety case. NASA has used AdvoCATE to successfully obtain regulatory approval for flight operations involving a fleet of small unmanned aircraft systems (UAS) flying beyond visual line of sight.

lnks.nom: Article: Tool Support for Assurance Case Development
Article: Model-driven Development of Safety Architectures

infos.title: Component Fault Tree
infos.author: Siemens
infos.description:
A Component Fault Tree is an extension of classic fault trees introducing a component concept which extends the advantages of model-based development to safety and reliability engineering. This provides a modular, hierarchical composition of system fault trees and facilitates their reuse.

The seamlessly integration of a Component Fault Tree approach in Capella allows safety engineers to define Fault Trees directly on components defined by systems architects.

infos.title: Modane
infos.author: CEA-DAM
infos.description: The continual increasing power of supercomputers allows numerical simulation codes to take into account more complex physical phenomena. Therefore, physicists and mathematicians have to implement complex algorithms using cutting edge technologies and integrate them in large simulators. To improve its simulators development cycle, the CEA-DAM has developed Modane, a tool based on Sirius, Xtext and EMF Compare.

infos.title: SimQRi
infos.author: CETIC
infos.description: Companies have to face increasing procurement risks especially in the globalisation context. SimQRi aims at providing a holistic approach to conduct and obtain procurement-specified risk assessments including internal risk treatment, with a specific focus on small and medium enterprises in the field of Mechanical Engineering. The methodology is supported by a Sirius-based Open Source tool that guides the user through the whole process of risk assessment with a logistics DSL and tables presenting results of Monte Carlo simulations.

infos.title: IRI Workbench for Voracity
infos.author: IRI, The CoSort Company
infos.description:
IRI Workbench provides a simple visual interface and ergonomic modules to design and run all job scripts. In this graphical IDE built on Eclipse, you build, modify, share, and execute the simple, portable job scripts of IRI tools, and the state-of-the-art, portable workflows of the new IRI Voracity platform.

IRI Workbench features metadata creation, conversion, discovery, and application wizards to help you generate, deploy, and manage the simple job scripts (SortCL, etc.), data definition files (DDF), and XML workflows common to all IRI software.

infos.title: BPMN Designer
infos.author: Obeo
infos.description:
BPMN Designer is based on the BPMN Domain Model of Eclipse Modeling MDT project.

It supports Flow Objects (Events, Activities, Gateways), Connecting Objects (Sequence Flow, Message Flow, Association), Swim lanes (Pool, Lane) and Artifacts (Data Object, Group, Annotation)

infos.title: Database Designer
infos.author: Obeo
infos.description: Database Designer is a graphical designer to define or edit relational tables and relations.

infos.title: Cinematic Designer
infos.author: Obeo
infos.description: Cinematic Designer allows the modeling of UI navigation by focusing on the description of Scenario, Flow, Transitions, Actions / Events, and the content of each screens with Widgets.

infos.title: EIP Designer
infos.author: Laurent Broudoux
infos.description:
A Sirius designer for Enterprise Integration Patterns.

It allows you to design integration routes using the common patterns and vocabulary used within Enterprise Application Integration or Enterprise Services Bus solutions.

infos.title: SmartMDSD
infos.author: Technische Hochschule Ulm
infos.description: SmartMDSD is an integrated development environment (IDE) that allows different roles that act around the development of robotics systems to offer building blocks and/or to reuse them and easily compose them to complex robotic software systems.

infos.title: PLAT4MC
infos.author: Robert Bosch
infos.description: PLAT4MC is tailored platform for the development of multi-core software systems. In this platform several visualization tools have been created with Eclipse Sirius.

infos.title: Xatkit Chatbot Diagrams
infos.author: Xatkit
infos.description:
Xatkit is a generic and extensible platform for developing all kinds of digital assistants.

Xtext and Sirius are work together inside Xatkit to make textual and graphical representations co-exist together in harmony

infos.title: S32 Design Studio
infos.author: NXP
infos.description: The S32 Design Studio is a complimentary Integrated Development Environment (IDE) for automotive and ultra-reliable Power Architecture® (e200 core) and Arm®-based microcontrollers and processors.

lnks.nom: Getting started with S32 Design Studio (video)

infos.title: TRADES Tool
infos.author: Israel Aerospace Industries / ELTA Cyber Division
infos.description: A threat and risk assessment (TRA) tool for the design of engineered systems. TRADES Tool is an open-source design tool, implementing a risk-based, cybersecurity assessment methodology. The underlying model-based approach promotes establishing and maintaining the system's cybersecurity posture throughout the system life cycle.

infos.title: OntoCASE4G-OWL
infos.author: Cotechnoe
infos.description: OntoCASE4G-OWL is a tool supporting the Graphical Ontology Web Language (G-OWL), a visual syntax for the graphical modeling and visualization of OWL 2 or RDFS ontologies.

lnks.nom: A Complete Visual Syntax for OWL 2 Ontology Modeling and Communication

infos.title: AWS Workbench
infos.author: RKVS Raman
infos.description: AWS Workbench is an ArchOps environment for designing and deploying AWS Infrastructure. It provides a "What You See Is What Is Deployed" (WYSIWID) view of infrastructure that improves cloud architecture design and deployment process.

infos.title: Sodalite IDE
infos.author: ATOS Spain
infos.description: Sodalite IDE is a tool suite that assists the users in the authoring of application deployment topology and infrastructure models for Infrastrcuture as Code (IaC). With focus on quality and performance, the IDE enables the faster and simpler development of IaC by offering features such as in-sync multiple model viewpoints , smart context-aware content assistance and semantic validation, powered by a Knowledge Base.

lnks.nom: A Smart Development Environment for Infrastructure as Code

infos.title: Hospital Situational Awareness System Design
infos.author: ELTA Systems
infos.description: This tool is a functional, working prototype of a new system designed for helping hospitals to support their effective operation, management and decision making.

lnks.nom: Modeling for Rapid Systems Prototyping: Hospital Situational Awareness System Design†

medias.imgAlt: IRIS - Grace Park (University of Texas at Dallas)

infos.title: IRIS
infos.author: Grace Park (University of Texas at Dallas)
infos.description: IRIS is a framework for aligning big data analytics with business in a goal-oriented approach in order to address the problems of big data/IoT, i.e., lack of business context around the data, lack of expertise to connect the dots, and implicit business objectives. It is composed of ontology for a business context model, analytics methods for connecting big data with business, a process for collaborative work and an assistant tool utilizing Spark for big data processing and Sirius for visualizing conceptual models of the ontology.

infos.title: Lyo Designer
infos.author: KTH Royal Institute of Technology
infos.description:
If you are developing modelling tools, you might be already considering their interoperability with other software applications.
Lyo Designer is an open source modeling tool that supports the architectural design and implementation of tool interfaces based on OSLC (Open Services for Lifecycle Collaboration) - an OASIS standard for the interoperability of heterogeneous software applications.
Lyo Designer includes an integrated code generator that synthesizes the toolchain model into almost-complete OSLC4J - compliant running implementation.

infos.title: CRALA
infos.author:
Huaxi Yulin ZHANG (University of Picardie Jules Verne, France)
Lei ZHANG (Northeastern University, China)
infos.description: A tool for modeling Cloud robotic systems from IaaS, PaaS and Saas 3-levels, including their variability.

infos.title: UbiBots
infos.author: Leibniz UniversitÃ¤t Hannover
infos.description:
Ubibots allows specifying complex interaction behaviors of ubiquitous cyber-physical systems.
In includes a simulation tool to execute scenarios on distributed robots. Sirius has been used to implement the visualization part.

infos.title: ASCET-CONGRA
infos.author: ETAS GmbH
infos.description: ETAS SCODE-CONGRA (CONstraint GRAph) allows function developers to depict mathematically describable relationships using interactive graphs. These describe the overall system based on equations, differential equations, maps, and curves. The tool checks all input for computability, automatically carries out the mathematical work in the background, and offers various analyses and functions that serve to implement, correctly and efficiently, the system to be developed. It includes interaction with an XText based model and cooperation with a textual representation.

infos.title: Palladio Component Model
infos.author: The Palladio Simulator group
infos.description: Palladio is an approach for performance evaluation and design-time performance prediction for component-based software architectures. When creating a Palladio model, at first, components are specified including their interfaces and abstractions of their behavior. This includes performance properties like resource demands. From these components, a system architecture can be assembled. The instances of the components can then be deployed on resource containers. A workload is then be applied to the system interface. Such a model can then be analyzed by the simulators of the Palladio approach.

infos.title: P&C Insurance Products
infos.author: MAIF
infos.description:
The MAIF insurance company has developped a graphical tool to manage the P&C products (property and casualty, IARD in french for Incendie, Accidents et Risques Divers).

It provides graphical representations to create, modify, consult, version and validate the products.

infos.title: Obeo SmartEA
infos.author: Obeo
infos.description: Obeo SmartEA is an enterprise architecture solution based on standards: ArchiMateÂ® and TOGAFÂ®. It operates natively with EMF and Sirius for defining metamodels and creating tailor-made modelling diagrams. It adapts to your domain to integrate your approach and help you manage your company's strategic changes. Thanks to its common repository shared between all the members of your Enterprise Architecture team, users can work on different versions of the same architecture.

infos.title: UML Designer
infos.author: Obeo
infos.description:
UML Designer is an open source modeling tool to edit and vizualize UML 2.5 models.

It provides the following generic UML diagrams: Package, Class, Component, Composite Structure, Deployment, Use Case, Activity, State Machine, Sequence, Profile

infos.title: Ecore Tools
infos.author: Obeo
infos.description:
Ecore Tools allows you to design Classes, Datatypes, References and all the classical Ecore constructions

It also provides specific layers to support concerns involved in expressing your domain model: documenting, reviewing the referencing mechanism of elements, identifying business constraints, exploring the model.

infos.title: ARTIST
infos.author: Safran-Sagem
infos.description: ARTIST eases engineering activities while developing safety-critical software embedded in complex system. It provides a wide set of services and interacts with a whole ecosystem.

infos.title: ModuleStudio
infos.author: Guite
infos.description: A DSL with tooling based on Sirius and Xtext to describe structure and behavior of web applications. The models are used to generate extensions for a PHP-based web application framework.

infos.title: NoSQL Visualization Tool
infos.author: CÃ¡tedra SAES & University of Murcia
infos.description: NoSQLVisualization is a tool designed to visualize schemas and schema versions which have been inferred from NoSQL databases. This tool defines several viewpoints such as trees and diagram compositions in order to visualize the main elements of NoSQL schemas: entities, versions, fields, aggregations and references.

infos.title: Plastic Manufacturing
infos.author: PEP
infos.description:
This modeler allows the collaborative design and development of complex plastic products.

It provides views dedicated to the several different business experts involved in the creation of such products: projects/solution, resources, costs, process, sequence

infos.title: MIMIC (Mobile Multimodality Creator)
infos.author: LIFL (University of Lille)
infos.description:
MIMIC is a model-based framework that enables the modeling and generation of multimodal mobile applications (Android and iPhone).

It allows multimodal mobile interfaces to be created more quickly, enabling rapid prototyping based on their designed models.

lnks.nom: Leveraging Sensor-based Interactions in Multimodal Mobile Applications

infos.title: Dart Designer
infos.author: Obeo
infos.description:
Dart Designer is an open source tool to build diagrams of your Dart applications.

It is based on a DSL defining concepts like Stylesheet, Package, Class, Mixin or even HTML pages. These concepts that you will manipulate in Dart Designer are either coming from the Dart programming language specification or from regular web application development.

infos.title: IFML Editor
infos.author: WebRatio / Atlanmod
infos.description:
IFML is an OMG standard designed for expressing the content, user interaction and control behavior of the front-end of software applications.

An IFML model supports the following design perspectives: view structure, view content, events, event transition, parameter binding, actions triggered by the user's events.

infos.title: Arduino Designer
infos.author: Obeo
infos.description:
The Arduino Designer allows kids to create small programs for Arduino.

It provides a graphical block language to be able to develop simple programs and run them on electronic modules.

infos.title: Telecom Reference Architecture
infos.author: Orange
infos.description:
This modeling tool implements Orange Lab's internal approach (RAL kit) to describe the architecture of IT solutions and services platforms.

It supports 4 viewpoints (usage, functional, software and infrastructure) and integrates with UML Designer.

infos.title: Satellite Software Modeling
infos.author: ESA (European Space Agency)
infos.description:
This tool is dedicated to the creation of satellite applications.

It supports seven views (Data Component, Behavioural, Hardware/Deployment, Non Functional, Implementation/Analysis and Packet Utilization Standard) via 19 kinds of diagrams and 8 kinds of tables.

infos.title: Timing Constraints
infos.author: Obeo
infos.description: This modeling tool provides additional layers over UML models in order to specify timing constraints: multi-clock, logical time, physical time.

infos.title: Risk Analysis Designer
infos.author: Alstom
infos.description: A tool to capture both parts of the system designs and parts of the safety analysis needed to build a critical systems.

infos.title: POOSL
infos.author: TNO-ESI
infos.description: POOSL (Parallel Object-Oriented Specification Language) is an expressive industry-proven modelling language with a formal semantics to describe both structure and concurrent, real-time and stochastic behavior. It exploits a combination of Xtext with Sirius to realize synchronized textual and graphical editing of POOSL models.

infos.title: Citrus
infos.author: Isoneo
infos.description:
Citrus is a product that supports the development cycle of a system, with an approach based on modeling and simulation.

It provides a studio to capture the system architecture, its interfaces and its breakdown structure into sub-systems/equipments.

infos.title: Safety Architect
infos.author: All4Tec
infos.description:
Safety Architect is a tool achieving risk analysis of complex systems using functional or physical architectures from usual modeling tools (for example SysML or UML).

It provides support to the implementation of FMEA and automatically deducts the FTA corresponding to the identified feared events.

infos.title: EMFTA
infos.author: Julien Delange
infos.description: EMFTA is an EMF-based FTA editor/visualizer. It provides a table to edit the content of the FTA (Gates and Events) and a diagram to graphically represent the FTA.

infos.title: IntelHome Designer
infos.author: University of South Britanny
infos.description:
IntelHome Designer is a graphical tool to configure home automation systems for disabled persons.

It consists in modeling a home with all its automated equipments. The model is used to generate configuration files for DANAH, a assistive technology system that pilots automated homes or medical structures.

infos.title: Lan Map Designer
infos.author: Obeo
infos.description: This modeler provides a map of RJ45 cable wiring in a building.

infos.title: LOA Graphical Editor
infos.author: ESEO
infos.description: This editor is based on LOA (Active Operations Language), a DSL dedicated to the design and the integration of rich graphical components and interactions.

lnks.nom: Slides by O. Beaudoux and M. Clavreul

infos.title: Graal Designer
infos.author: Obeo
infos.description: Graal Designer provides the ability to specify the users needs and their interactions with a system by defining tasks, use cases, user stories and interaction aspects a system should offer.

infos.title: GRAF Designer
infos.author: Capgemini
infos.description: GRAF is a method created by Capgemini to describe the architecture of complex Information Systems.

infos.title: SysML Designer
infos.author: Obeo
infos.description:
SysML Designer is an open source modeling tool to edit and vizualize SysML 1.2 models.

It provides the following generic SysML representations: Block Definition Diagram (BBD), Internal Block Diagram (IBD), Requirements Table, Requirements Cross Table, Parametric Diagram and UML standard diagrams.

infos.title: MoSaRT Framework
infos.author: ENSMA
infos.description:
MoSaRT (Modeling oriented Scheduling analysis of Real-Time systems) is a model-based framework for designing and analyzing real-time systems.

The framework is based on the MoSaRT design language and the MoSaRT analysis repository, and presents a helpful modeling support for both designers and analysts.

infos.title: Farming DSLs
infos.author: Inria Rennes / Obeo
infos.description:
A set of DSLs with tooling based on Sirius and Xtext to describe an agricultural exploitation from a structural and behavioral point of view.

This description is then used for simulation and constraints statisfaction checking.

infos.title: VerCors
infos.author: Inria Sophia Antipolis
infos.description: VerCors is a tool platform for the analysis and verification of safety and security properties of distributed applications.

infos.title: Nasdanika Vinci
infos.author: Nasdanika LLC
infos.description: A Sirius-based tool for modeling and generation of web sites using diagram and tree representations.

lnks.nom: Site created in Get Started guide

infos.title: FHIR Designer
infos.author: Maria Cecilia Ariste
infos.description: FHIR Designer is based on the open-source healthcare standard FHIR of HL7. It allows to design conceptual models of healthcare systems based on an international open source standard that defines resources of information for interoperatibily between heathcare systems.
